We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Officer / Field Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To:&nbsp;Chief Executive Officer

Job Description


	The Human Resources Officer is responsible for delivering efficient people management support across client organizations.
	The role covers recruitment and onboarding, employee record management, payroll administration, training coordination, and performance management.
	The Officer will also ensure compliance with labor laws and organizational policies while fostering an engaging, supportive, and productive workplace for all employees.


Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records for assigned clients.
	Support the development and implementation of HR policies, procedures, and best practices.
	Administer monthly payroll: prepare schedules, verify salaries/deductions, and upload final files for processing.
	Liaise with client HR departments to reconcile payroll discrepancies.
	Process statutory remittances (PAYE, VAT, pensions, NHF, NSITF, etc.) accurately and on time.
	Coordinate end-to-end recruitment processes: job postings, candidate screening, interviews, and onboarding.
	Manage employee relations, including grievances, conflicts, and disciplinary procedures in line with policy.
	Support performance management cycles: appraisals, feedback, and performance improvement initiatives.
	Organize, track, and report on training, learning, and development programs.
	Ensure compliance with labor laws, company policies, and industry regulations.
	Prepare and present HR reports, including staff turnover, absenteeism, and workforce analytics.
	Monitor employee attendance, leave, and time-off requests.
	Coordinate health, safety, wellness, and employee engagement initiatives.
	Recommend and contribute to HR process improvements and system enhancements for clients.


Requirements


	HND / Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in human resources management, Business Administration, Industrial Relations, or related field.
	5&ndash;7 years of relevant HR experience in a structured organization (consulting/outsourcing experience is an advantage).
	Membership of CIPM, SHRM, or related professional body is desirable.


The Ideal Candidate:


	Strong knowledge of HR management practices, labor law, and employee relations.
	Proficient in Microsoft Excel/Google Sheets and HR information systems.
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills.
	Highly organized, detail-oriented, and approachable.
	Ability to work independently, collaboratively, and in a client-facing capacity.


Method of Application

Human Resource Officer / Field Officer Job at Roomy Outsourcing




        
    

        
        Roomy Outsourcing is a company that provide comprehensive and innovative human resources outsourcing solutions as part of an integrated end to end HR solutions model. What sets us apart from other firms is our thorough understanding of an organization’s essential core areas and how they work together to enhance and improve a company’s overall performance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Officer / Field Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Chief Executive Officer

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Human Resources Officer is responsible for delivering efficient people management support across client organizations.
	The role covers recruitment and onboarding, employee record management, payroll administration, training coordination, and performance management.
	The Officer will also ensure compliance with labor laws and organizational policies while fostering an engaging, supportive, and productive workplace for all employees.


Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records for assigned clients.
	Support the development and implementation of HR policies, procedures, and best practices.
	Administer monthly payroll: prepare schedules, verify salaries/deductions, and upload final files for processing.
	Liaise with client HR departments to reconcile payroll discrepancies.
	Process statutory remittances (PAYE, VAT, pensions, NHF, NSITF, etc.) accurately and on time.
	Coordinate end-to-end recruitment processes: job postings, candidate screening, interviews, and onboarding.
	Manage employee relations, including grievances, conflicts, and disciplinary procedures in line with policy.
	Support performance management cycles: appraisals, feedback, and performance improvement initiatives.
	Organize, track, and report on training, learning, and development programs.
	Ensure compliance with labor laws, company policies, and industry regulations.
	Prepare and present HR reports, including staff turnover, absenteeism, and workforce analytics.
	Monitor employee attendance, leave, and time-off requests.
	Coordinate health, safety, wellness, and employee engagement initiatives.
	Recommend and contribute to HR process improvements and system enhancements for clients.


Requirements


	HND / Bachelor’s degree in human resources management, Business Administration, Industrial Relations, or related field.
	5–7 years of relevant HR experience in a structured organization (consulting/outsourcing experience is an advantage).
	Membership of CIPM, SHRM, or related professional body is desirable.


The Ideal Candidate:


	Strong knowledge of HR management practices, labor law, and employee relations.
	Proficient in Microsoft Excel/Google Sheets and HR information systems.
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills.
	Highly organized, detail-oriented, and approachable.
	Ability to work independently, collaboratively, and in a client-facing capacity.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: info@roomyoutsourcing.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Content / Social Media Executive Job at Apex Network




        
    

        
        Apex Network is a Financial servicing firm, where anyone anywhere can easily and securely transact Bitcoin, which is the future of Money and a catalyst for creating and open financial system in Africa and the World.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content / Social Media Executive

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Description
     

            
    




	Apex Network is seeking a talented and dynamic Content/Social Media Executive to join our growing team.
	The ideal candidate is not just passionate about storytelling but is also confident in front of the mic—with experience in voice-over production and a strong grasp of trending content formats across platforms.
	If you live and breathe social media, love experimenting with new tools, and can effortlessly switch between TikTok edits and YouTube descriptions, this role is for you!


Requirements


	Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field.
	2+ years of experience in social media management or content creation.
	Strong voice-over and narration skills (audio or video samples may be requested).
	Hands-on experience with CapCut, Premiere Pro, Hootsuite, Notion, TikTok Studio, and YouTube Studio.
	Excellent written and visual storytelling skills.
	Comfortable working in a fast-paced hybrid environment.
	Reside in Lagos, Nigeria (non-negotiable).


Benefits


	Private Health Insurance
	Pension Plan
	Paid Time Off
	Training & Development
	Performance Bonus.

  "title": "Unit Manager",
  "description": "At Brit Properties Nigeria Limited, we go beyond mere land sales; we specialize in constructing legacies. From the initial embrace within our fold, we embark on a collaborative journey to shape your future. Understanding your vision, dissecting your desires, and translating them into concrete possibilities are the pillars of our partnership.

Your dreams need not linger in the realm of distant aspirations. With Brit Properties Nig Limited, they metamorphose into tangible realities. Serving as the conduit between aspiration and accomplishment, we act as catalysts, turning dreams into keys that open the doors to your personalized sanctuary.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Unit Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Uyo, Akwa Ibom&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time
